PMID:25466412; Original text:In-depth genotyping of 46 published coronary artery disease risk loci of genome-wide significance in the worldwide largest case-control sample of the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis (the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis) with the Illumina Immunochip (600 German the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis cases, 1448 controls) and the Affymetrix 500K array set (283 German the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis cases and 972 controls) highlighted ANRIL as the major risk gene and revealed further associations with the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis for the gene PLASMINOGEN (PLG; rs4252120: P=5.9×10(-5); odds ratio, 1.27; 95% confidence interval, 1.3-1.4 [adjusted for smoking and sex]; 818 cases; 5309 controls).|PMID:25466412; Original text:Subsequent combined analyses of several genome-wide data sets of coronary artery disease and the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis suggested TGFBRAP1 to be associated with the severe early-onset phenotype aggressive periodontitis (rs2679895: P=0.0016; odds ratio, 1.27 [95% confidence interval, 1.1-1.5]; 703 cases; 2.143 controls) and coronary artery disease (P=0.0003; odds ratio, 0.84 [95% confidence interval, 0.8-0.9]; n=4117 cases; 5824 controls).
